workflow.name: Track government grants with OpenRouter AI, RSS feeds, Google Sheets & Gmail
workflow.description:
## How it works
This workflow automatically fetches the latest public grant information from the Ministry of Health, Labour and Welfare (MHLW) RSS feed.  
It uses AI to summarize and structure each grant post into a clear format, stores the results in Google Sheets, and sends a formatted HTML summary via Gmail.

**Workflow summary**
1. Schedule Trigger ‚Äì Runs the flow daily or weekly.  
2. RSS Feed Reader ‚Äì Fetches the latest MHLW news and updates.  
3. Text Classifier (AI) ‚Äì Categorizes the item as ‚ÄúGrant/Subsidy‚Äù, ‚ÄúLabor-related‚Äù, or ‚ÄúOther‚Äù.  
4. AI Agent ‚Äì Extracts structured data such as title, summary, deadline, amount, target, and URL.  
5. Google Sheets ‚Äì Appends or updates the database using the grant title as the key.  
6. Code Node ‚Äì Builds an HTML report summarizing new entries.  
7. Gmail ‚Äì Sends a daily digest email to your inbox.

---

## Setup steps
1. Add your **OpenRouter API key** as a credential (used in the AI Agent).  
2. Replace the **Google Sheets ID** and sheet name with your own.  
3. Update the **recipient email** address in the Gmail node.  
4. Adjust the **schedule trigger** to match your preferred frequency.  
5. (Optional) Add more RSS feeds if you want to monitor other sources.

---

## Ideal for
- Consultants or administrators tracking subsidy and grant programs  
- Small business owners who want automatic updates  
- Anyone who wants a daily AI-summarized government grant digest  

---

‚öôÔ∏è **Note:**  
Detailed explanations and setup hints are included as **Sticky Notes** above each node inside the workflow.

workflow.name: AI-Powered Government Grant Tracker (RSS ‚Üí AI ‚Üí Google Sheets ‚Üí Email)

parameters.content:
$23F0 Schedule
$2022 Entry point of the workflow.
$2022 Set how often this flow runs (hourly, daily, weekly, etc.).

$D83D$DCF0 RSS Feed
$2022 Fetch grant-related updates from MHLW RSS.
$2022 You may add more RSS feeds if needed.

$D83D$DD01 Batching
$2022 Process feed items in batches.
$2022 Helps with stability and API rate limits.

$D83C$DFF7$FE0F AI Classification
$2022 Categorize each item by title/summary.
$2022 Used for filtering or routing later.

options.systemMessage:
You are an expert at summarizing and structuring information about public grants.

From the given RSS item fields, extract and return a JSON object with the keys below:
1. title $2013 grant title
2. summary $2013 brief summary (~100 chars)
3. deadline $2013 application deadline (or 'Unknown')
4. amount $2013 grant amount (or 'Unknown')
5. target $2013 target audience / eligible organizations
6. url $2013 original URL
7. published_date $2013 published date

Return ONLY valid JSON.

parameters.content:
$D83E$DD16 AI Extraction
$2022 Convert each feed item into a consistent JSON structure.
$2022 Extract deadline/amount/target/URL/published date.

parameters.jsonSchemaExample:
{
  "title": "SME Productivity Enhancement Subsidy (Round 3)",
  "summary": "Supports SMEs' investment in digitalization and efficiency improvements.",
  "deadline": "2025-11-29",
  "amount": "Up to 10M JPY ($2264 2/3)",
  "target": "SMEs / small businesses",
  "url": "https://example.go.jp/subsidy/2025/productivity3",
  "published_date": "2025-11-01"
}

parameters.content:
$D83E$DDE9 Output Parser
$2022 Provides an example schema to keep keys consistent.
$2022 Helps prevent malformed JSON.

documentId.cachedResultName: Grant DB (replace Spreadsheet ID if needed)

parameters.content:
$D83D$DCCA Google Sheets Upsert
$2022 Append or update rows keyed by Title.
$2022 Adjust column headers to your sheet.

$D83D$DCE6 Aggregate
$2022 Combine newly processed items for reporting.
$2022 Pass a single payload downstream.

parameters.jsCode:
const items = $input.item.json.data; let html = `

New Grants Found

`; for (const item of items) { html += ` `; } html += `
TitleSummaryURLDeadlineAmountTargetPublished
${item['Title'] ?? ''} ${item['Summary'] ?? ''} ${item['URL'] ?? ''} ${item['Deadline'] ?? ''} ${item['Amount'] ?? ''} ${item['Target'] ?? ''} ${item['Published'] ?? ''}
`; return { html_body: html };

parameters.content:
$D83E$DDF1 HTML Builder
$2022 Generate an HTML table for the email body.
$2022 Customize columns and styles as needed.

$2709$FE0F Gmail
$2022 Send the HTML summary to your recipients.
$2022 Replace 'sendTo' and subject per environment.

data.details: The Code node allows you to execute JavaScript in your workflow.
